oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A lion sits waiting for the sun to set so he can stalk people. The people lie down to sleep and the lion steals up on them and drags |a!karaken into the grove. The people name the grove '|a!karaken's grove' after |a!karaken who was carried there by the lion. 1) |han=kass'o heard this story from his mother (|xabbi-an); the dead woman's little sister, whose name |han=kass'o does not remember as they lived at his place before he was born, 2) p.7364v: on Driedoorn trees (or !nabba), 3) pp.7375v-7375 1/2v: (29 August) |han=kass'o feared the grove of !nabba trees (|a!karaken's grove) because his grandfather had warned him that lions were lying in wait there; speaking to and escaping death from a lion, 4) This story is found in Book VIII-15.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: |a!karaken killed by a lion
